content.question: The circuit shown contains a solenoid in series with a variable resistor and an ideal battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>∆ê</mi></math>. The variable resistor is adjusted to resistances <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="R sub 3 is greater than R sub 2, which is greater than R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, allowing time for the circuit to reach steady state between each setting. Which of the following correctly compares the inductances <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="L sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> of the solenoid when the resistances are <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="L sub 1 equals L sub 2, which equals L sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub 1 is greater than L sub 2, which is greater than L sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub 3 is greater than L sub 2, which is greater than L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub 2 is greater than L sub 3, which is greater than L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub 1 equals L sub 2, which equals L sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
